info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 1:14PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A cluster of thunderstorms will impact portions of Mineral, western Missoula and southwestern Sanders Counties through 215 PM MDT... At 113 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of thunderstorms extending from De Borgia to 12 miles south of Tarkio. Movement was north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Superior, Riverbend, Haugan, De Borgia, St. Regis, Tarkio, Lozeau, Quartz and Cyr. This includes Interstate 90 between mile markers 11 and 70. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
